sentence.Network_en: Each brick also varies slightly in tone, texture and size.
sentence.Network_cn: 每块砖在色调、质地与大小上也都略有不同。

sentence.Network_en: On South Main Street, a huge brick building looms into view.
sentence.Network_cn: 在南大街上，一座巨大的砖砌建筑赫然出现在人们的视线中。

sentence.Network_en: He flattened himself against a brick wall as I passed.
sentence.Network_cn: 他紧贴一面砖墙站着好让我通过。

lj.lj_ly: untold acres are being buried under bricks and mortar.
lj.lj_ls: 数不清的土地正被用来建造房屋。

phrase.cizu_name: come up against (或 hit) a brick wall

jx.jx_en_mean: face an insuperable problem or obstacle while trying to do something

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)具有压倒性的重量（影响或权威），势不可挡

lj.lj_ly: the FA came down on him like a ton of bricks.

phrase.cizu_name: you can't make bricks without straw

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)nothing can be made or accomplished without proper or adequate material or information
To make a clumsy social error.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Middle Low German, Middle Dutch bricke, brike; probably reinforced by Old French brique; of unknown ultimate origin

entry.def: Bricks are rectangular blocks of baked clay used for building walls, which are usually red or brown. Brick is the material made up of these blocks.

example.ex: She built bookshelves out of bricks and planks.
example.tran: 她用砖和木板制作书架。

example.ex: ...a tiny garden surrounded by high brick walls.
example.tran: 四周有高高的砖墙环绕的小花园

entry.def: If you say that someone is a brick, you mean that they have helped you or supported you when you were in a difficult situation.

example.ex: You were a brick, a real friend in need.
example.tran: 你很够朋友，是真正的患难之交。

entry.def: If you are banging your head against a brick wall, what you are saying or doing is not having any effect although you keep saying or doing it.

example.ex: I wanted to sort out this problem with him, but it was like banging my head against a brick wall.
example.tran: 我曾想跟他把这个问题给解决了，但结果徒劳无功。

entry.def: If you hit a brick wall or come up against a brick wall, you are unable to continue or make progress because something stops you.

example.ex: After that my career just seemed to hit a brick wall...
example.tran: 在那之后我的事业似乎就陷入了困境。

example.ex: The discussions in Brussels hit a brick wall.
example.tran: 在布鲁塞尔进行的商谈进展受阻。

entry.def: You can use bricks and mortar to refer to houses and other buildings, especially when they are considered as an investment.

example.ex: Paying rent simply helps to line the pockets of landlords. It's far better to put your money into bricks and mortar of your own...
example.tran: 租房子只会鼓了房东的腰包，自己投资买房要合算得多。

example.ex: As an investment, bricks and mortar are not what they were.
example.tran: 作为一种投资，房产不再是从前意义上的房产。

means.word_mean: 1. rectangular block of clay baked by the sun or in a kiln; used as a building or paving material
2. a good fellow; helpful and trustworthy

list.explanation: 联邦调査局级别很低的工作人员

example.en: brick agents the Federal infantry who knock on doors, track down mysterious emigres.
example.zh: 联邦调查局级别最低的工作人员就是联邦政府的跑腿，他们走街穿巷跟踪形迹可疑的流亡者。

example.en: You can bet London to a brick that it'll rain tomorrow.
example.zh: 你可以确信明天会下雨。

sentences.en: The old man stood on a pile of bricks almost as high as a house.
sentences.cn: 那位老人站在一堆跟房子差不多高的砖上。

sentences.en: He murdered his wife, and bricked up her body in the kitchen.
sentences.cn: 他杀死了妻子, 然后把她的尸体藏在厨房里, 用砖堵死。

jushi.english: Our house is made of red brick(s).
jushi.chinese: 我们的房子是用红砖盖的。

jushi.english: As we did not need three doors to the room, we blocked in the space of one of them with bricks.
jushi.chinese: 因为这个房间不需要三道门,所以我们就把其中一道用砖堵上了。

jushi.english: He asked for a brick of ice cream.
